skill.name: chronicle-workflow
skill.description: Complete workflow for tracking development work with Chronicle - session recording, git tracking, AI summarization, and Obsidian documentation. Works with CLI commands (portable) or MCP tools (faster). Use when starting a new development session, setting up project tracking, or when user wants comprehensive session management.
skill.summary: Complete workflow for tracking development work with Chronicle - session recording, git tracking, AI...
skill.author: ChandlerHardy

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-only skill containing only workflow documentation. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution. Skill provides guidance on using Chronicle CLI commands but does not execute any code itself.

content.value_statement: Development work often gets lost in terminal sessions. Chronicle records everything you do and generates AI summaries so you can find past work, build a knowledge base, and avoid repeating mistakes.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through Chronicle session setup and start commands
Explain CLI commands for session listing, timeline, and search
Describe chunked summarization for large sessions
Provide multi-project tracking and filtering patterns
Outline Obsidian integration for knowledge base building
limitations: Only works on Unix systems with script command available
Cannot retroactively track sessions started without Chronicle
Users must manually start sessions with chronicle start command
MCP tools require separate Chronicle MCP server installation

use_cases.title: Track Daily Development
use_cases.description: Record each coding session and build searchable history of your work over time

use_cases.title: Audit Team Progress
use_cases.description: Track what the team worked on, link commits to sessions, and review summaries

use_cases.title: Build Knowledge Base
use_cases.description: Export sessions to Obsidian and create interconnected documentation from past work

prompt_templates.title: Start Session
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to start tracking this development session with Chronicle. Help me set it up correctly.

prompt_templates.title: Check Tracking
prompt_templates.prompt: Am I currently in a Chronicle tracked session? If not, how do I start one?

prompt_templates.title: Review Past Work
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me my Chronicle sessions from yesterday related to [topic] so I can remember what I was working on.

prompt_templates.title: Full Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through the complete Chronicle workflow from starting a session, through development, to documenting to Obsidian.

output_examples.input: Help me track my coding session
output: To track this session, exit and restart with Chronicle: exit, then chronicle start claude
Current session is not being tracked - Chronicle only tracks sessions started with its command
During the session, make frequent git commits - Chronicle links them automatically
When done, type exit - transcript saves automatically and summary generates on first view

best_practices: Start Chronicle sessions early since retroactive tracking is not possible
Make frequent git commits within sessions for better session-commit linking
Document important sessions to Obsidian to build a searchable knowledge base
Use context retriever skill to find past work before starting new related tasks
anti_patterns: Waiting until the end of work to start Chronicle - cannot track retroactively
Skipping commits during sessions - misses valuable tracking context
Never reviewing summaries - defeats the purpose of session documentation
Using Chronicle without Obsidian integration - loses searchable knowledge base benefits

faq.question: What systems does Chronicle support?
faq.answer: Chronicle requires Unix systems with the script command. Not available on Windows without WSL.

faq.question: How large can sessions be?
faq.answer: Sessions of unlimited size work through chunked summarization. Tested with 83,000+ line sessions.

faq.question: Does Chronicle integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, Obsidian integration via MCP tools and git commit linking within 30-minute windows.

faq.question: Is my data safe with Chronicle?
faq.answer: Yes, local-first storage in ~/.ai-session/ with SQLite. Only AI summaries leave your machine.

faq.question: Why is my session not being tracked?
faq.answer: Chronicle only tracks sessions started explicitly with chronicle start claude or similar command.

faq.question: How does Chronicle compare to manual notes?
faq.answer: Automatic transcript capture, AI summarization, git linking, and searchable history outperform manual notes.
